results.content: The content is fantastic...however he speaks very quickly. Pause is your best friend. I found I had to supplement his explanations however, since I didn't get the in-depth details of using the coordinates on the clipping path. I would have liked the full step by step on the parrot site as on the other sites, especially on the use of the calc() function to get the sizes of the left and right divs. Rahul does say, however, that he covers calc in his csscasts course. The level of creativeness, however, is ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC!!!!! AWESOME!!!!! Had no idea this was possible in css. Has changed how I think about css. Would love to see some of his other websites--no doubt he is implementing his creativeness to leverage css shapes on those as well. THANK YOU RAHUL!

response.content:
Super welcome Tami, and thank you for the in-depth feedback, really appreciate it, you've made my day. 
From my next course, I'll try to speak slower. Cheers

results.content: High energy, tons of information, good examples.  The language was the only difficulty.  Its a lot to absorb.  I will watch more times and I am sure the accent will not be as prohibitive.  Would take another course from him.

results.content: Great course a lot of knowledge shared. The instructor explains all the properties which is important. So that you don't only know how to do it, but also know why it works. It would have been nice if, there were some quizzes and especially short exercises. To test if the student really understood the subject. This would make all this new knowledge stick more and made the course a bit more fun
